## Purpose of R Stats Bootcamp

<br>

Provide a self-guided resource to:

- `Learn or refresh skills` in R scripting, basic statistics

- `Boost success` in statistics for assessments, project work

- Be accessible with `no prior knowledge`

<br>


## Who is the R Stats Bootcamp for?

<br>

- `Students` in applied sciences

- Aspiring `data scientists`

- `Academic colleague` who want to learn R

- `Postgraduate researchers`

- Other nteresting people (who want to learn from data)

<br>

<center>

</center>


## What will you learn

<br>

- `R scripting` basics

- Best practice for `reproducible research`

- `Tidy data` practice

- A practical review of `basic statistics` (just enough...)

## R Stats Bootcamp organization

<br>

<center>

[https://rstats-bootcamp.github.io/website/](https://rstats-bootcamp.github.io/website/)

</center>

<br>

`Module 1`: Introduction to `R and Rstudio` 

`Module 2`: R for `traditional data analysis`

`Module 3`: `Reproducible code`, R Markdown, and GithuB


## R Stats Bootcamp organization

<br>

**Module 1: R scripting**

1.1 R syntax

1.2 Functions and packages

1.3 Data objects

1.4 Data frames

1.5 Data sub-setting and manipulation


## R Stats Bootcamp organization

<br>

**Module 2: Statistics review**

2.1 Question, explore, analyze

2.2 Sampling distributions

2.3 Correlation

2.4 Simple linear regression

2.5 T-test

2.6 1-way ANOVA

## R Stats Bootcamp organization

<br>

**Module 3: reproducibility, collaboration**

3.1 Reproducibility

3.2  Automate reports

3.3 Git and version control
